id: Technical Seminar for Architects, Designers & Specifiers - WELLINGTON CITY- Abel Smith Street Wellington, Wellington Region-Event Brite
name: Technical Seminar for Architects, Designers & Specifiers - WELLINGTON CITY
venue: Abel Smith Street Wellington, Wellington Region
description:
CPD Event - Wellington City Date: 20th August Time: 5pm - 7pm Location: Southern Cross Garden Bar Join us for a focused 2-hour technical seminar for architects, designers and specifiers exploring practical moisture mitigation strategies and innovative solutions to improve condensation control and energy efficiency in New Zealand buildings.
From foundation to roof, this session will provide valuable insights into managing moisture and enhancing thermal performance using proven technologies and methods tailored to local conditions.
Don't miss out on the chance to network with like-minded individuals, earn 20 NZRAB CPD points, LBP learning evidence provided, and gain valuable insights.
Nibbles and drinks provided.
Speakers from DriSpace, Comfortech Building Performance Solutions®, NZ Steel and Firth Concrete

id: Structured literacy approaches, years 0-8, Wellington 2025-. Wellington, Wellington .-Event Brite
name: Structured literacy approaches, years 0-8, Wellington 2025
description:
Empower your school with structured literacy approaches – PLD for years 0-8 Join us for professional learning and development (PLD) designed to help schools implement evidence-based structured literacy approaches across Years 0-8.
Our expert facilitators work alongside teachers and school leaders to strengthen literacy instruction, ensuring every learner develops the skills to succeed.
✔ Implement a clear, systematic, and cumulative approach to literacy.
✔ Strengthen decoding, fluency, comprehension, and writing instruction.
✔ Support learners who need additional scaffolding and intervention.

id: Targeted and tailored structured literacy approaches - Wellington-. Wellington, Wellington Region .-Event Brite
name: Targeted and tailored structured literacy approaches - Wellington
description:
Tāwhirihia is a fully funded, year-long professional learning opportunity for the one teacher in each school, with the staffing entitlement to lead targeted and tailored support.
If that’s you, this course will deepen your expertise in structured literacy approaches and equip you to make a measurable difference for students in Years 0–2 who need it most.
You’ll build, apply, and refine your practice through three integrated strands: Te Hau Mātea – Five full-day, in-person workshops to build deep knowledge and practical tools Day One and Two: 19th and 20th August Day Three and Four: 4th and 5th November Day Five: 25th November Te Hau Piritahi – Five short online sessions to reinforce strategies and share insights with peers Te Hau Arotahi – Small-group coaching to apply learning in context, adapt instruction, and stay on track.
A 60 min online introductory session will be held preceding the first day - date TBC Each strand builds on the last — helping you turn evidence into action, and action into impact.
NB; The MOE fund one teacher per school.

id: Craigs Women's Wealth: The Reality of Investing - Nelson-Maitai Room Trafalgar Street Nelson, Nelson Region-Event Brite
name: Craigs Women's Wealth: The Reality of Investing - Nelson
venue: Maitai Room Trafalgar Street Nelson, Nelson Region
description:
At Craigs Women’s Wealth we encourage you to take action and revisit your financial goals to ensure you are in the position to live the life you want.
This is also your opportunity to ask Michelle anything about markets and investing, and to clear away the roadblocks that may be holding you back.
Please RSVP by Friday 15th August.
Craigs Investment Partners is a NZX Participant Firm.
Your information will be handled in accordance with our Privacy Statement.

id: Getting Paid Faster- Hardy Street Nelson, Nelson-Event Brite
name: Getting Paid Faster
description:
A strong credit management process ensures your business has a framework in place to manage your debtors and respond faster to late-paying customers.
Our complimentary seminar, Getting Paid Faster, will show you practical and proven strategies to ensure you’re getting paid as fast as possible.
Join us on Wednesday 20th August at 9:30am for this 60-minute seminar, where you’ll: · Understand the impact slow payers have on your business · Learn what best practice debtor management looks like · Identify key strategies to reduce the time it takes your customers to pay you · Understand how to approach overdue debtors with empathy · Learn how you can improve your Cash Conversion Cycle We’ll provide all attendees with a Credit Management Guide and Credit Management Script Templates to support you to get paid.

id: Organizational Skills 1 Day Training-PH: + Washington, DC United States-Event Brite
name: Organizational Skills 1 Day Training
description:
Through Organizational Skills you will encounter improved productivity, better management, and an overall increase in professional growth.
Everyday people waste numerous amounts of time looking for items.
So stop looking for those important items, and start knowing where they are by getting organized.
Target Audience: Anybody who is interested in learning Organizational Skills.
Learning Objectives:● By the end of this course you will be able to: Remove the Clutter Prioritize Scheduling Your Time To Do Lists Paper and Paperless Storage Organization Your Work Area Tools to Fight Procrastination Organizing your Inbox Avoid the Causes of Disorganization Discipline is the Key to Stay Organized Prerequisites: None Course Materials: Attendees will receive a course manual with presentation slides and reference materials.

id: 3 Gals, One Beehive – live!-, NTT Tower Lambton Quay Wellington, Wellington Region-Event Brite
name: 3 Gals, One Beehive – live!
venue: , NTT Tower Lambton Quay Wellington, Wellington Region
description:
3 Gals, One Beehive – live!
Hear three leading women take a week in politics, and turn it into the unfiltered commentary that you wish you’d hear on the 6 o’clock news.
Because this is a reminder that politics isn't just about policies and power plays - it's about stories, people and the laughs that come with it.
Whether you're a political junkie, or just dipping your toes into current affairs, Three Gals One Beehive invites you to pull up a chair, pour a glass of wine and join the conversation that's as enlightening as it is entertaining: Whether it's recounting drama that’s reminiscent of a House of Cards episode or assessing the strategic manoeuvres that would be at home in The Queen’s Gambit, their podcast promises to make even the driest political topics engaging.
This event is part of the Women in Business chapter from our “Join the Conversation” series - 4 events that spotlight important topics through conversation, led by the amazing women driving change within them.

id: Professional Development Essentials 1 Day Training-PH: + Washington, DC United States-Event Brite
name: Professional Development Essentials 1 Day Training
description:
Certificate: Course Completion Certificate Language: English Duration: 1 Day Credits: 8 Course Delivery: Classroom Refreshments: Snacks, Beverages and Lunch included in a classroom session Course Overview: The first step to achieve your professional goals is to clarify what professional success means to you.
Under the guidance of an expert coach, this one-day Professional Development training course provides you with the knowledge and skills to leverage a reflecting, thinking, and planning process, and create a personal development plan to accelerate your individual career goals.
Course Feature: You Will Learn How To: Identify and apply your talents, strengths, and competencies Demonstrate the attitudes and behaviors of professional people Develop your supporting network by operating with integrity and respect Build your credibility and manage your professional reputation Create a personal action plan for professional success Certification: Once after the training you receive course completion certificate from Mount Skills.
Who can Attend?
No formal prerequisites are required to attend this course.

id: Peace Over Panic: Rewiring the Anxious Mind- Vivian Street  Wellington, Wellington-Event Brite
name: Peace Over Panic: Rewiring the Anxious Mind
description:
Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars: Peace Over Panic: Rewiring the Anxious Mind How do we respond when the mind spirals, when uncertainty clouds our judgement, or when we find ourselves at a personal breaking point?
This workshop draws from ancient and time-tested wisdom found in yoga philosophy — especially the Bhagavad Gita — to explore how anxiety and inner conflict can become turning points for insight and conscious action.
Rather than avoiding or suppressing discomfort, the Gita offers a way to meet it — with clarity, honesty, and meaningful direction.
Through a blend of philosophical reflection and grounded tools, we’ll explore how to steady the mind and reconnect with deeper purpose in the face of pressure or doubt.
The seminar will be followed by a delicious plant-based dinner together, all included in your ticket!

id: Maramataka High Tea- Heriot Drive Porirua, Wellington Region-Event Brite
name: Maramataka High Tea

id: Peace over Panic - Rewiring the Anxious Mind- Vivian Street  Wellington, Wellington-Event Brite
name: Peace over Panic - Rewiring the Anxious Mind
description:
Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars: Peace over Panic - Rewiring the Anxious Mind Transform your relationship with anxiety in just 60 minutes using the revolutionary FasterEFT technique that's helping thousands worldwide break free from the grip of panic and overwhelm.
In "Peace over Panic - Rewiring the Anxious Mind," you'll discover how your mind creates anxiety through unconscious patterns and learn a simple yet powerful tapping method to literally rewire your nervous system for calm and confidence.
Unlike traditional therapy that can take months or years, FasterEFT works at the subconscious level where anxiety is actually created, allowing you to experience immediate relief and lasting change.
Whether you struggle with daily worry, panic attacks, or overwhelming stress, this workshop will give you practical tools to take control of your mental state and create the peaceful, confident life you deserve.
Leave with a complete system you can use anywhere, anytime to transform anxiety into inner peace.

id: It's in the Ballot-HDC- Wednesday 20th August Production Day Pass-In-studio- Main Street Foxton, Manawatū-Whanganui Region-Event Brite
name: It's in the Ballot-HDC- Wednesday 20th August Production Day Pass-In-studio
description:
Contestants of 'It's in the Bag' become political candidates in 'It's in the Ballot' Meet the Candidates.
Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative.
We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.

id: Social Sewing Saturday - August- Beauchamp Street Karori Wellington, Wellington-Event Brite
name: Social Sewing Saturday - August
description:
Whether you're a seasoned pro or just starting out, this event is perfect for anyone who loves to sew.
Don't forget to pack your sewing machine, fabric, and any other supplies you'll need.
Parking is free and there are 3 dedicated spaces for the centre as well as others closeby.
Cost: Free for members of the Karori Arts Centre or $15 per person payable directly to KACC.
(Membership of the centre is $105 annually and also gives you reductions on classes and access to other groups) Please do NOT attend if you are sick (even just a little bit!)

id: Wellington Murder Mystery: Death in the Shadows- Molesworth Street Wellington, Wellington-Event Brite
name: Wellington Murder Mystery: Death in the Shadows
description:
Now, since you're New Zealand's best detective, it’s up to you to dig out the truth and catch the murderer: Was it Walter, the obsessed boyfriend?
Was it Percy, the ghost tour guide with a flair for the dramatic?
The app will guide you all the way.📍 About Questo Questo is your ticket to real-world adventure, blending storytelling with thrilling exploration!
💡New to Questo?
Check out our Player’s Guide for everything you need to know before you start!

id: Palmerston North Murder Mystery: Solve the case!-Church Street Palmerston North, Manawatū-Whanganui-Event Brite
name: Palmerston North Murder Mystery: Solve the case!
description:
You walk the streets investigating every corner for a clue and you feel the adrenaline rush in your blood as you collect pieces of evidence and get closer to finding the murderer.
The ordinary streets, that you've visited many times, are now your personal universe, where every corner hides a secret and every landmark tells part of the story.
🗺️🔎 Discover hidden gems, solve fun puzzles, and create unforgettable memories along the way.
Begin your adventure now at www.questoapp.com!
💡New to Questo?

id: CLAY & BUBBLES Hand build your own ceramic butter dish- Tinakori Road Wellington, Wellington-Event Brite
name: CLAY & BUBBLES Hand build your own ceramic butter dish
description:
Join us for a relaxed, hands-on workshop where you'll create your very own ceramic butter dish in a working pottery studio.
Over two inspiring hours, you'll learn the basics of hand-building with clay, guided step-by-step by a ceramic artist.
Unwind with a glass of bubbles as you get creative with shaping, decorating, and embellishing your piece.
You'll finish by choosing your preferred glaze colours, and we'll take care of the firing process.
Your finished butter dish will be ready to collect approximately four weeks later.

id: After Austen: Em- Willis Street Wellington, Wellington-Event Brite
name: After Austen: Em
description:
We are so excited to welcome award-winning playwright Sam Brooks, to discuss his play Em, a queer retelling of Jane Austen’s masterwork Emma, turned around, flipped and set in our very own Queenstown.
Emmett Woodhouse, handsome, clever and rich, with a comfortable home and a gay disposition has lived nearly [redacted] years in the world with very little to distress or vex him.
Until now.
Attendees get an exclusive 10% discount at Unity Books Sam Brooks is an award-winning and prolific playwright and journalist, who is largely noted for his critically acclaimed LGBTQ+ work, including Riding in Cars with (Mostly Straight) Boys, Queen, and most recently This is My Story of Us, which was co-winner of the 2024 Adam New Zealand Play Award.
He has been shortlisted multiple years for the Adam New Zealand Play Award, and won the Dean Parker award in 2023.

id: Girlss Offline Book Club- Courtenay Place Wellington, Wellington Region-Event Brite
name: Girlss Offline Book Club
description:
Join us for a cosy night of books, banter, and good vibes at Rick Rolls!
Whether you're a bookworm or just looking to meet new people, this is the perfect midweek reset.
Bring the book you're currently reading and any you're ready to swap.
Your ticket includes your first cocktail on arrival and kai to nibble on throughout the night.
Expect a laid-back evening of great convos, new reads, and a chance to connect with like-minded readers.

Cost: Free for members of the Karori Arts Centre or $15 per person payable directly to KACC.
(Membership of the centre is $105 annually and also gives you reductions on classes and access to other groups) Please do NOT attend if you are sick (even just a little bit!)

id: Peace Over Panic: Rewiring the Anxious Mind- Vivian Street  Wellington, Wellington-Event Brite
name: Peace Over Panic: Rewiring the Anxious Mind
description:
Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars: Peace Over Panic: Rewiring the Anxious Mind How do we respond when the mind spirals, when uncertainty clouds our judgement, or when we find ourselves at a personal breaking point?
This workshop draws from ancient and time-tested wisdom found in yoga philosophy — especially the Bhagavad Gita — to explore how anxiety and inner conflict can become turning points for insight and conscious action.
Rather than avoiding or suppressing discomfort, the Gita offers a way to meet it — with clarity, honesty, and meaningful direction.
Through a blend of philosophical reflection and grounded tools, we’ll explore how to steady the mind and reconnect with deeper purpose in the face of pressure or doubt.
The seminar will be followed by a delicious plant-based dinner together, all included in your ticket!

id: Resene Wallpaper Evening- Cambridge Street Levin, Manawatū-Whanganui-Event Brite
name: Resene Wallpaper Evening
description:
Join us for a Resene Wallpaper Evening!
Get inspired by our wide selection of patterns and colours, perfect for adding a touch of style to any room.
Our expert will be on hand to offer tips and advice on choosing the perfect wallpaper for your home.
Plus get all your wallpaper questions answered by our wallpaper expert!
Don't miss out on this exciting opportunity to transform your space with Resene wallpapers!

id: After Austen: Em- Willis Street Wellington, Wellington-Event Brite
name: After Austen: Em
description:
We are so excited to welcome award-winning playwright Sam Brooks, to discuss his play Em, a queer retelling of Jane Austen’s masterwork Emma, turned around, flipped and set in our very own Queenstown.
Emmett Woodhouse, handsome, clever and rich, with a comfortable home and a gay disposition has lived nearly [redacted] years in the world with very little to distress or vex him.
Until now.
Attendees get an exclusive 10% discount at Unity Books Sam Brooks is an award-winning and prolific playwright and journalist, who is largely noted for his critically acclaimed LGBTQ+ work, including Riding in Cars with (Mostly Straight) Boys, Queen, and most recently This is My Story of Us, which was co-winner of the 2024 Adam New Zealand Play Award.
He has been shortlisted multiple years for the Adam New Zealand Play Award, and won the Dean Parker award in 2023.

id: 3 Gals, One Beehive – live!-, NTT Tower Lambton Quay Wellington, Wellington Region-Event Brite
name: 3 Gals, One Beehive – live!
venue: , NTT Tower Lambton Quay Wellington, Wellington Region
description:
3 Gals, One Beehive – live!
Hear three leading women take a week in politics, and turn it into the unfiltered commentary that you wish you’d hear on the 6 o’clock news.
Because this is a reminder that politics isn't just about policies and power plays - it's about stories, people and the laughs that come with it.
Whether you're a political junkie, or just dipping your toes into current affairs, Three Gals One Beehive invites you to pull up a chair, pour a glass of wine and join the conversation that's as enlightening as it is entertaining: Whether it's recounting drama that’s reminiscent of a House of Cards episode or assessing the strategic manoeuvres that would be at home in The Queen’s Gambit, their podcast promises to make even the driest political topics engaging.
This event is part of the Women in Business chapter from our “Join the Conversation” series - 4 events that spotlight important topics through conversation, led by the amazing women driving change within them.

id: Resene Wallpaper Evening- Kapiti Road Paraparaumu, Wellington-Event Brite

description:
Nau mai haere mai ki Te Kunenga ki Pūrehuroa.
Please join us on our Wellington campus, Pukeahu.
You will be welcomed by one of our Future Students team who will guide you through the campus showing you key facilities, enabling you a glimpse into life at Massey University, Te Kunenga ki Pūrehuroa.
Our tour dates for Wellington Campus 2025 are March 21st, April 11th, May 16th, June 13th, July 4th, July 11th, August 15th, September 19th, October 3rd, October 10th, and November 21st and takes just over an hour and a half to 2 hours.
You are able to view the accommodation after the campus tours, no need to book separately.

id: It's in the Ballot - PNCC–Te Hirawanui General Ward-In-studio- The Square Palmerston North, Manawatu-Wanganui-Event Brite
name: It's in the Ballot - PNCC–Te Hirawanui General Ward-In-studio
description:
Contestants of 'It's in the Bag' become political candidates in 'It's in the Ballot' Meet the Candidates.
Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative.
We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.

id: Avenoir- Dixon Street Te Aro Wellington, Wellington-Event Brite
name: Avenoir
venue: Dixon Street Te Aro Wellington, Wellington
description:
Avenoir, a unique and innovative Dance Performance choreographed by Jenire, delves into the idea of what life would be like experienced backwards.
Is the unknown of one's life journey really a curse or is it a blessing?
It’s like driving through the fog, trying to see ahead.
Have those past rejoin your life again, look forward to your best days and prepare for your worst) Sage: Now beginning life with insight and awareness, you pass on this wisdom and guide those close.
Exuberant: The one that is left now returns to life, bringing back all innocence and purity to the joyfulness of early life.

id: Peace over Panic - Rewiring the Anxious Mind- Vivian Street  Wellington, Wellington-Event Brite
name: Peace over Panic - Rewiring the Anxious Mind
description:
Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars: Peace over Panic - Rewiring the Anxious Mind Transform your relationship with anxiety in just 60 minutes using the revolutionary FasterEFT technique that's helping thousands worldwide break free from the grip of panic and overwhelm.
In "Peace over Panic - Rewiring the Anxious Mind," you'll discover how your mind creates anxiety through unconscious patterns and learn a simple yet powerful tapping method to literally rewire your nervous system for calm and confidence.
Unlike traditional therapy that can take months or years, FasterEFT works at the subconscious level where anxiety is actually created, allowing you to experience immediate relief and lasting change.
Whether you struggle with daily worry, panic attacks, or overwhelming stress, this workshop will give you practical tools to take control of your mental state and create the peaceful, confident life you deserve.
Leave with a complete system you can use anywhere, anytime to transform anxiety into inner peace.

id: Peace Over Panic: Rewiring the Anxious Mind- Vivian Street  Wellington, Wellington-Event Brite
name: Peace Over Panic: Rewiring the Anxious Mind
description:
Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars: Peace Over Panic: Rewiring the Anxious Mind How do we respond when the mind spirals, when uncertainty clouds our judgement, or when we find ourselves at a personal breaking point?
This workshop draws from ancient and time-tested wisdom found in yoga philosophy — especially the Bhagavad Gita — to explore how anxiety and inner conflict can become turning points for insight and conscious action.
Rather than avoiding or suppressing discomfort, the Gita offers a way to meet it — with clarity, honesty, and meaningful direction.
Through a blend of philosophical reflection and grounded tools, we’ll explore how to steady the mind and reconnect with deeper purpose in the face of pressure or doubt.
The seminar will be followed by a delicious plant-based dinner together, all included in your ticket!

id: Organizational Skills 1 Day Training-PH: + Washington, DC United States-Event Brite
name: Organizational Skills 1 Day Training
description:
Through Organizational Skills you will encounter improved productivity, better management, and an overall increase in professional growth.
Everyday people waste numerous amounts of time looking for items.
So stop looking for those important items, and start knowing where they are by getting organized.
Target Audience: Anybody who is interested in learning Organizational Skills.
Learning Objectives:● By the end of this course you will be able to: Remove the Clutter Prioritize Scheduling Your Time To Do Lists Paper and Paperless Storage Organization Your Work Area Tools to Fight Procrastination Organizing your Inbox Avoid the Causes of Disorganization Discipline is the Key to Stay Organized Prerequisites: None Course Materials: Attendees will receive a course manual with presentation slides and reference materials.

id: Targeted and tailored structured literacy approaches - Wellington-. Wellington, Wellington Region .-Event Brite
name: Targeted and tailored structured literacy approaches - Wellington
description:
Tāwhirihia is a fully funded, year-long professional learning opportunity for the one teacher in each school, with the staffing entitlement to lead targeted and tailored support.
If that’s you, this course will deepen your expertise in structured literacy approaches and equip you to make a measurable difference for students in Years 0–2 who need it most.
You’ll build, apply, and refine your practice through three integrated strands: Te Hau Mātea – Five full-day, in-person workshops to build deep knowledge and practical tools Day One and Two: 19th and 20th August Day Three and Four: 4th and 5th November Day Five: 25th November Te Hau Piritahi – Five short online sessions to reinforce strategies and share insights with peers Te Hau Arotahi – Small-group coaching to apply learning in context, adapt instruction, and stay on track.
A 60 min online introductory session will be held preceding the first day - date TBC Each strand builds on the last — helping you turn evidence into action, and action into impact.
NB; The MOE fund one teacher per school.

id: Structured literacy approaches, years 0-8, Wellington 2025-. Wellington, Wellington .-Event Brite
name: Structured literacy approaches, years 0-8, Wellington 2025
description:
Empower your school with structured literacy approaches – PLD for years 0-8 Join us for professional learning and development (PLD) designed to help schools implement evidence-based structured literacy approaches across Years 0-8.
Our expert facilitators work alongside teachers and school leaders to strengthen literacy instruction, ensuring every learner develops the skills to succeed.
✔ Implement a clear, systematic, and cumulative approach to literacy.
✔ Strengthen decoding, fluency, comprehension, and writing instruction.
✔ Support learners who need additional scaffolding and intervention.

id: Palmerston North Murder Mystery: Solve the case!-Church Street Palmerston North, Manawatū-Whanganui-Event Brite

description:
You walk the streets investigating every corner for a clue and you feel the adrenaline rush in your blood as you collect pieces of evidence and get closer to finding the murderer.
The ordinary streets, that you've visited many times, are now your personal universe, where every corner hides a secret and every landmark tells part of the story.
🗺️🔎 Discover hidden gems, solve fun puzzles, and create unforgettable memories along the way.

id: Craigs Women's Wealth: The Reality of Investing - Nelson-Maitai Room Trafalgar Street Nelson, Nelson Region-Event Brite
name: Craigs Women's Wealth: The Reality of Investing - Nelson
venue: Maitai Room Trafalgar Street Nelson, Nelson Region
description:
At Craigs Women’s Wealth we encourage you to take action and revisit your financial goals to ensure you are in the position to live the life you want.
This is also your opportunity to ask Michelle anything about markets and investing, and to clear away the roadblocks that may be holding you back.
Please RSVP by Friday 15th August.
Craigs Investment Partners is a NZX Participant Firm.
Your information will be handled in accordance with our Privacy Statement.

id: CLAY & BUBBLES Hand build your own ceramic butter dish- Tinakori Road Wellington, Wellington-Event Brite
name: CLAY & BUBBLES Hand build your own ceramic butter dish
description:
Join us for a relaxed, hands-on workshop where you'll create your very own ceramic butter dish in a working pottery studio.
Over two inspiring hours, you'll learn the basics of hand-building with clay, guided step-by-step by a ceramic artist.
Unwind with a glass of bubbles as you get creative with shaping, decorating, and embellishing your piece.
You'll finish by choosing your preferred glaze colours, and we'll take care of the firing process.
Your finished butter dish will be ready to collect approximately four weeks later.

🗺️🔎 Discover hidden gems, solve fun puzzles, and create unforgettable memories along the way.
Begin your adventure now at www.questoapp.com!

id: Palmerston North Murder Mystery: Death in the Shadows-Church Street Palmerston North, Manawatū-Whanganui-Event Brite
name: Palmerston North Murder Mystery: Death in the Shadows
description:
Now, since you're New Zealand's best detective, it’s up to you to dig out the truth and catch the murderer: Was it Walter, the obsessed boyfriend?
Was it Percy, the ghost tour guide with a flair for the dramatic?
The app will guide you all the way.📍 About Questo Questo is your ticket to real-world adventure, blending storytelling with thrilling exploration!

id: Peace Over Panic: Rewiring the Anxious Mind- Vivian Street  Wellington, Wellington-Event Brite
name: Peace Over Panic: Rewiring the Anxious Mind
description:
Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars: Peace Over Panic: Rewiring the Anxious Mind How do we respond when the mind spirals, when uncertainty clouds our judgement, or when we find ourselves at a personal breaking point?
This workshop draws from ancient and time-tested wisdom found in yoga philosophy — especially the Bhagavad Gita — to explore how anxiety and inner conflict can become turning points for insight and conscious action.
Rather than avoiding or suppressing discomfort, the Gita offers a way to meet it — with clarity, honesty, and meaningful direction.
Through a blend of philosophical reflection and grounded tools, we’ll explore how to steady the mind and reconnect with deeper purpose in the face of pressure or doubt.
The seminar will be followed by a delicious plant-based dinner together, all included in your ticket!

id: Social Sewing Saturday - August- Beauchamp Street Karori Wellington, Wellington-Event Brite
name: Social Sewing Saturday - August
description:
Whether you're a seasoned pro or just starting out, this event is perfect for anyone who loves to sew.
Don't forget to pack your sewing machine, fabric, and any other supplies you'll need.
Parking is free and there are 3 dedicated spaces for the centre as well as others closeby.
Cost: Free for members of the Karori Arts Centre or $15 per person payable directly to KACC.
(Membership of the centre is $105 annually and also gives you reductions on classes and access to other groups) Please do NOT attend if you are sick (even just a little bit!)
